data.name: Hln1Text
data.value: We already had shared cars, shared bicycles and shared scooters, and next weekend Ghent will also be introduced to shared boats. The Muide - Meulestede - Afrikalaan district will receive three striking, blue electric vessels to cruise around with, after a short training course. Lieven Van Holle came up with the project and received money from the District Budget to realize it.

data.name: Hln2Text
data.value: If you live in Ghent, you live on the water. But building a boat yourself is not for everyone. That is why an idea emerged from Lieven Van Holle's brain: Buut. Shared boats for the Muide residents. From Sunday, everyone in the neighborhood can reserve a boat.

data.name: VrtText
data.value: The boat sharing system of vzw Buut was presented at the Muidebrug. Three electric boats are shared with the residents of the Muide, Meulestede and Afrikalaan districts. "Everyone who becomes a member is a co-owner and must treat the boats as if they were their own," responds initiator Lieven Van Holle. "We hope that users will respect our material

data.name: VrtTitle
data.value: The Ghent district shares three boats with residents and vulnerable groups
